Text: A summer plumaged Grey Plover on Pit 132 this morning. (Duncan Dine).

The male BLACK-WINGED STILT still today from Zeiss hide on the Top New Piece. Also two Greenshanks, a drake GARGANEY and a pair of Common Terns. Three drake GARGANEYS on the Rushy. A drake Pochard and a Common Sandpiper on South Lake. (Slimbridge Sightings).
Off of Hock Ditch 115+ Ringed Plovers, 10+ Dunlins, 10+ Sanderlings and two Little Stints today. (Rob Strong).

At Nagshead at least five Pied Flycatchers, five Spotted Flycatchers, a female Mandarin with three juveniles, a Great Spotted Woodpecker feeding young in a tree, a Sparrowhawk, several Treecreepers and a Green Woodpecker. (Paul Clark/Chris Snook). Three Buzzards, 6+ Chiffchaffs, two Garden Warblers and many Four-spotted Chasers and Broad-bodied Chasers at Woorgreens. 3+ Grey Wagtails, two Dippers, 10+ Mandarins, two Tufted Ducks and a Kingfisher at Cannop Ponds and Stoneworks. (Paul Clark).
At Lower Rea this afternoon, a Curlew mobbing a Red Kite over the river at 4pm, also a Lesser Whitethroat, a Whitethroat and two Kingfishers on the canal near Rea Bridge. (Steve Pullen).

Two Curlews, 15 Greylags with eight goslings, 66 Mallards, 35 Canada Geese, three Swallows, five House Martins, three Pied Wagtails, two Grey Herons, three Chaffinches, a Chiffchaff and a Blackcap. (John Fletcher).
This morning a Hobby and a Kestrel over Netherend Farm. (Ant Dobbs).
A Red Kite over the M5 Motorway Services this afternoon. (Howard Taylor).
150/200 House Martins along the cycle track and above the houses. (Megan Adamou).

The male BLACK-WINGED STILT still today around the grounds. A drake GARGANEY and three Greenshanks from Zeiss hide. A Little Ringed Plover, a drake Pochard and a Common Sandpiper on South Lake. (Slimbridge Sightings).
A Peregrine on the church tower this morning. (Scott Petrek).

Around Court Lake this morning an elusive Spotted Flycatcher, a Cuckoo, a Kingfisher, a Sparrowhawk, a Common Tern, two Reed Warblers and two Cetti’s Warblers. (MK). At least five Hobbies over Court Lake this afternoon, also a Red Kite,  two Oystercatchers on one of the islands, the Ross’s Goose and a Tufted Duck with two ducklings. (Terry Grant).
At Pittville Lawn a Great Spotted Woodpecker being pursued by a female Blackbird. (Howard Taylor).
At Horsebere Brook FSA a Mute Swan, three Mallards, four Reed Buntings, a Yellow Wagtail, two Linnets, a Whitethroat, two Skylarks on adjacent farmland and five Stock Doves. (Paul Brunt).

This afternoon a Hobby, a Kingfisher, ten House Martins, four Sand Martins, five Swifts, two Swallows, five Blackcaps, a Willow Warbler, seven Chiffchaffs, three Goldfinches, three Song Thrushes, a Pied Wagtail, a Whitethroat, a drake Tufted Duck, five Mallards, seven Moorhens including two chicks, two Red-legged Partridges, two Great Spotted Woodpeckers, a Greenfinch, three Little Egrets, a Buzzard and two Mute Swans. (John Fletcher).

Between West Down car park and Belas Knap long barrow today a Willow Warbler, a Chiffchaff, a Blackcap, a Whitethroat, a Lesser Whitethroat, a Swallow and a Swift. At Belas Knap two pairs of Redstarts, a Red Kite, a Kestrel, a Buzzard and a Raven. Also Dingy Skipper, Small Tortoiseshell, Red Admiral, Holly Blue, Small Heath butterflies and a Burnet Companion moth. (Keith White).

Over the silage fields today six Red Kites, 11 Buzzards, two Kestrels and a Hobby over late evening. Also Whitethroats around the hedgerows and several Greenfinches by the sewage works. (Paul Sutton).

The male BLACK-WINGED STILT around the grounds today. Four Greenshanks and a pair of Common Terns on the Top New Piece. (Slimbridge Sightings). A CATTLE EGRET on the Tack Piece at 11:55am then flew N. (Julian Gould). Two drake GARGANEYS on the Rushy early morning. Also a Grey Plover from Middle Point. (Mark Hobson). Also a Little Ringed Plover on the Rushy today. (Nigel Young).
An adult breeding plumage CATTLE EGRET flew NE upriver past Purton at 2:50pm. (Francis Steuck).

Four Little Ringed Plovers, nine Ringed Plovers, a Dunlin, two Oystercatchers, seven Redshanks, two Curlews, two Yellow Wagtails, two Swifts, a Little Egret, a Little Grebe chick, a Garden Warbler, Sedge Warblers, a Lesser Whitethroat and a Whitethroat. Also a Roebuck. Along the canal a Redstart, a Chiffchaff, a Great Spotted Woodpecker, a Cetti’s Warbler, a Skylark and a Little Owl. (Les Ditchburn).
12 Red Kites, two Buzzards, two Kestrels, 20+ Lesser Black-backed gulls and 50+ corvids all taking good advantage of silaging. (Eden Tanner).
At Woorgreens two Garden Warblers, a Goshawk and a Downy Emerald dragonfly. (Eden Tanner).
At least eight Red Kites, 24+ Buzzards, a Kestrel, three Ravens and two Hobby sightings, probably the same one over grass cutting in the fields. (Paul Sutton).
Three Red Kites at 4pm high over Highfields Garden Centre slowly heading NE. (Tim McGrath).

Lots of Raven activity today with both juveniles and the adults on numerous training flights. A Buzzard and a Red Kite over this afternoon and two Great Spotted Woodpeckers visiting a nest hole. (David Lawrence).
A Red Kite and a Hobby high over the garden at 5:30pm. (Steve Pullen).

On the Top New Piece from Zeiss hide the BLACK-WINGED STILT and a pair of Common Terns and a Little Ringed Plover. On the Bottom New Piece three Greenshanks. A Little Ringed Plover on the Rushy early morning, later one on South Lake maybe the same, and a Common Sandpiper on South Lake. From Middle Point at least 14 Sanderlings and two Grey Plovers. (Slimbridge Sightings/Esther Rumsey/Dan Fletcher).
Two Red Kites over the Edgemoor Inn at midday. On Rudge Hill an adult Tawny Owl mobbed then chased by Blackbirds, a Kestrel and four Willow Warblers. (MK).
Three Red Kites over the garden W to E at 2:25pm. (Ty Mein).
A Red Kite flew low to the A38 near the Prince of Wales hotel heading N at 3:30pm. (Tim McGrath).

Three Avocets, two Redshanks, an Oystercatcher, two Little Ringed Plovers, a Ringed Plover, a Curlew, three Little Egrets, broods of Lapwings and Mallards, a juvenile Little Grebe, a Cuckoo, three Yellow Wagtails, a pair of Wigeon, a pair of Teal and a Lesser Whitethroat along the canal. (Sam Walker).
A Cuckoo calling near Lower Parting. (Helen Bojaniwska). At Alney Island two Buzzards, a Blackcap, two Chiffchaffs, two Sedge Warblers, a Cetti’s Warbler heard and a Reed Bunting. (Paul Brunt).
Three Swifts N over the A436 at 11am. (Andy & Sue Gibbons).
A Corn Bunting singing and showing well NE of Fairford and E of the Fairford to Hatherop road. (John Durell).
Three Ravens, two adults and a juvenile regularly visiting the garden. (Brian Elloway).
A Grey Heron and a Black-headed Gull on the canal at Purton bridge, a Cuckoo heard near the hulks and a Sedge Warbler near the old railway bridge. (Mike Fisher).
Four active House Martin nests on the Dockers club. (Mike Fisher).
A Greenshank, two Common Terns and the Common Crane pair with two chicks on the Top New Piece from Zeiss hide. (Helen Bojaniwska).

A pair of Ringed Plovers, a drake GARGANEY, a male Ruff and two Lapwing broods. (Ian Ralphs). This morning a male LESSER SPOTTED WOODPECKER briefly along the canal then flew off E. Also today numerous Sedge Warblers, Reed Buntings, Whitethroats and Chiffchaffs, a Little Egret, three Avocets, two Oystercatchers, a pair of Little Ringed Plovers, Yellow Wagtails, two Curlews, Redshanks and at least 1 Sand Martin. (Christopher Widdowson).
A Red Kite over Abbeymead at 2:20pm. (Ken Hurcombe).
A Red Kite over very low then circled up drifting SSE at 4pm. (Paul Masters).
5/6 Red Kites circling over the A38 between Newport and Stone at 11:30am. (Hinton Birder).
At the pools a Common Tern, a Kingfisher, a Hobby and a mass emergence of Common Blue and Red-eyed Damselflies. (Tim McGrath).

This morning 10+ Swifts over Northleach town centre. At Hampnett 20+ House Martins collecting mud from a small road side pool. A singing Corn Bunting in a tree just off the A436 on the road towards Brockhampton. (John Casswell).
At Granna Lane two Buzzards circling over and a Raven heard. (Howard Taylor).

The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT gave brief perched views at 8:48am and 9:55am and a couple of flight views, it wasn’t singing today. No further reports received today. The drake Goldeneye still in the Eider Pen, a mobile pair of Common Terns and a Pochard on South Lake. A Red Kite past Hogarth hide, a Common Sandpiper and the Common Crane chick briefly in view. (Slimbridge Sightings/Jonathan Bull).
A Common Sandpiper on the bank of the Glos-Sharpness Canal close to Shepherd’s Patch late afternoon. (James Robinson).
Eight Red Kites flew N over the garden in the village today. (Gordon Hodgson). Two Hobbies over Court Lake this morning. Also two Common Terns. (Paul Masters/Andy Chapman).
A Red Kite over at 9:50am. (MK).
A Red Kite over at 2:40pm heading N. (Dave Stone).
At least 11 Red Kites, and at least four Buzzards following a tractor turning the soil this afternoon. (Andrew & Gill Worthington).

Two Little Ringed Plovers, four Redshanks, a male Ruff, four Oystercatchers, six Avocets, two Curlews, a Lapwing and chick, a Common Sandpiper, a juvenile Little Grebe, a drake GARGANEY, a Wigeon, three Grey Herons, three Little Egrets, two Common Gulls, a Little Owl, Lesser Whitethroat, Whitethroat, Chiffchaff, Sedge Warbler, a Pied Wagtail, a Grey Wagtail and two Yellow Wagtails today. (Les Ditchburn/Richard Cawsey/Alan McIlquham/Paul Sutton).
At Nagshead a few Pied Flycatchers today, a female Mandarin and 4+ juveniles and a female Redstart. A Dipper at Lower Cannop pond and many Mandarins. (Mike Davis).
Mid afternoon a Common Sandpiper, three Whitethroats, two Sedge Warblers, 70 Black-headed Gulls and 45 Lesser Black-backed Gulls. (John Fletcher).
16 Swifts and four House Martins over the town this evening. (Jake King).
The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT showed at Middle Point for c1 min at 9:55am in the reedbed left of the path. A drake GARGANEY on the Rushy. (Slimbridge Sightings et al).
At lunchtime a HONEY BUZZARD high over heading NE, nine Hobbies, two Red Kites, a Buzzard and a Sparrowhawk. (Nick Goatman).

This afternoon an adult SPOONBILL, a Little Ringed Plover, a male Cuckoo calling, a Common Sandpiper and four Lesser Whitethroats along the canal. (Ken Heron & Jenny Jones). This evening the SPOONBILL still and a Great White Egret, two Curlews, five Lapwings, two Redshanks, a Ringed Plover and three Yellow Wagtails. (Helen Preston Gibb).
A male and female Siskin feeding together on the bird table this afternoon. (Vic Polley).

The BLACK-WINGED STILT around the grounds still today. This afternoon it was on the Tack Piece and showing well. (Slimbridge Sightings). The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT reverted to type singing and calling sporadically between 8:30-11:45am and showing once in flight at 10am at Middle Point. It did a few brief display flights between 1:30-2pm but did not perch in view between 8:30am-2pm. It was not seen again by 3:30pm and as far as I know there are no later reports. Also a passing Marsh Harrier. (MK).
At Nagshead this morning six Spotted Flycatchers, five Firecrests and a Pied Flycatcher. (Nigel Sluman).
Around the pools a Little Grebe with three young, two pairs of Mute Swans with 11 cygnets, five Hobbies, a Sparrowhawk, five Common Terns, two Oystercatchers and ten Shelducks over. (Nick Goatman).

At the Bill Smyllie reserve a singing Tree Pipit, several singing Willow Warblers and Blackcaps. and a Buzzard. Butterflies included many Small Blues, Small Heath, Marsh Fritillary, Dingy Skipper, Brimstone and Common Heath and Cinnabar moths. (Keith White). Also a Wood Tiger moth. (Duncan Dine).
A Red Kite over the house at 11am at Bridgend. (Paul Sutton).
c20 Skylarks, c10 Yellowhammers, a Kestrel and a Whitethroat today. (Simon Hart).
A pair of Ravens with two fledged juveniles today. (David Lawrence).

The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT showing today on and off on stick perches at Middle Point. Generally it is very elusive and requires time and patience. (Martin McGill et al). The BLACK-WINGED STILT on South Lake before relocating on the Rushy late in the day but not for long. Three drake GARGANEYS on the Rushy today. (Slimbridge Sightings). Three Red Kites over the car park at 1pm. (Carol Rushton & Steve Curtis).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF still in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing and showing, often high in the Beech canopy. (Jake Klavins). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120

Three Ringed Plovers, a Snipe, a Common Sandpiper, a Curlew and a Water Rail near the car park. A Garden Warbler singing from the tow path. (Ian Hull). Also along the canal seven Lesser Whitethroats, a pair of Bullfinches, two Chaffinches, a Song Thrush and a Little Egret. From the Grundon hide birds included 11 Mute Swans, four Canada Geese, five Grey Herons, three Little Egrets,  a Redshank, an Avocet, four Lapwings, two Swifts a Reed Warbler, a Skylark and a Swallow. From the New hide birds included ten Mute Swans, four Shovelers, two Grey Herons, a Sparrowhawk, an Oystercatcher and a Common Crane. (Howard Taylor).
At least eight Hobbies and a Red Kite over Court Lake and a Great Spotted Woodpecker feeding young in a nest on one of the islands this afternoon. (Terry Grant).
Just S of the village at lunch time six Yellowhammers, a Lesser Whitethroat, three Whitethroats, five Skylarks and three Linnets. (Steve Pullen).

This afternoon two Redstarts, two Green Woodpeckers, two Buzzards, two Stock Doves, a Skylark, four Goldcrests and three Ravens. Also Muntjacs barking in the woods and good numbers of Common Blue and Brown Argus butterflies. (Steve Pullen).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF still in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing and showing, often high in the Beech canopy. (Lauren & Wayne, NSL-Birding). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120

Two POMARINE SKUAS through NE over the Severn N of Black Rock Breakwater at 11:35am, last seen 11:39am leisurely heading high inland over Saul, a dark phase bird with full ‘spoons’ and a pale bird. (Martin McGill). The BLACK-WINGED STILT on the Rushy early on before relocating to South Lake for the remainder of the day. Four drake GARGANEYS on the Rushy today. (Slimbridge Sightings). A Red Kite NW over the Rushy at 1:50pm. A singing Lesser Whitethroat heard from the carpark at 3:25pm.(Andy & Sue Gibbons). A Red Kite low over Middle Point early afternoon, possibly same bird. (Les Ditchburn/Jake King).
A Red Kite over the A38 between Cambridge and the Eastington turn at 4pm. (Andy & Sue Gibbons).
This morning c8 Whitethroats, a Chiffchaff, c15 Long-tailed Tits, a Treecreeper, a Dipper, a Red Kite and a Buzzard over the house heading N. A Barn Owl over the house late last night. (Paul Sutton).
Over Court Lake nine Hobbies, three Red Kites and a Hairy Dragonfly. Five Common Terns on the Sailing Lake. (Nick Goatman).
A Redstart, two Swifts, a Common Sandpiper and a Blackcap. (Eric Harris).
A breeding plumaged Ruff and a Little Egret this morning. (Duncan Dine).

Seven Greylags, including two family parties, with seven and one gosling, three Canada Geese, a male Shelduck, 104 roosting Mallards and a female with five ducklings, a Great White Egret, a pair of Curlews and singing Redstart, Blackcap, Whitethroat and Chiffchaff. (Mike Smart).
Two Curlews and song from Sedge Warbler, Lesser Whitethroat, Whitethroat, Willow Warbler and Reed Bunting. (Mike Smart).
Two Little Egrets and song from Redstart, Blackcap and Chiffchaff. (Mike Smart).

A BLACK-WINGED STILT today which very flighty and toured the hides for much of the day and went missing for long periods before settling down on the Hogarth hide late afternoon. Also a drake Garganey on the Rushy and a Common Sandpiper from Hogarth hide. (Martin McGill et al).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF still in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing and showing, often high in the Beech canopy. (Dan Watson et al). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120

Birds today included four Canada Geese, 16 Shelducks, two Mallards, a Grey Heron, four Oystercatchers, 18 Ringed Plovers, a Little Ringed Plover, a Dunlin, a Sanderling, 29 Curlews, two Whimbrels, six Redshanks, two Yellow Wagtails, a Meadow Pipit, a Reed Warbler and two Reed Buntings. (Mike Smart).
A Hobby S of the main university today. (Jeremy Squire).
Two Hobbies and a Swallow over the garden this morning. (Dawn Ballinger).
A Hobby circling over the garden today. (Harvey Sherwood).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF still in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing and showing, often high in the Beech canopy until 3:15pm at least. (Alan Boddington). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120
This morning 15+ Meadow Pipits, 5+ Linnets, three Tree Pipits, two Garden Warblers, two Redstarts , a Goshawk and a pair of Crossbills feeding in the pines on the summit. (William Lambourne).

From Grundon hide today 70 Black-headed Gulls, 15 Mute Swans, 14 Shelducks, 12 Canada Geese, five Greylags, four Little Egrets, four Oystercatchers, two Curlews, Lapwing, Skylark and 34 Mallards with nine ducklings. (Howard Taylor/Ian Ralphs). Also today two Wigeon, seven Shovelers, 13 Gadwalls, two Tufted Ducks, three Redshanks, two Avocets, a Little Ringed Plover, six Coots, two Moorhens and two Cetti’s Warblers. (Ian Ralphs).
Two Hobbies over Court Lake at 2pm today. (Simon Hart).
A Little Ringed Plover on South Lake. (Dot Jones).
Two Grey Wagtails on the culvert by the cinema today. (Donna Cook).

At Over beside the Herefordshire-Gloucestershire canal this morning birds included two Kingfishers, six Blackcaps, three Chiffchaffs, two Willow Warblers, two Great Spotted Woodpeckers, a Green Woodpecker, a Kestrel, four Mute Swans (two cygnets), five Mallards, two Cormorants, three Swifts, two Swallows and nine House Martins. (John Fletcher).
A Whitethroat, three Buzzards, four Ravens, eight Swallows, a Chiffchaff and a Grey Heron. (Paul Sutton).

A Dipper, a Chaffinch, a Chiffchaff, two Buzzards and two Grey Wagtails. Also Beautiful and Banded Demoiselle, Emerald, Common Blue, Blue-tailed and Red-eyed Damselflies and Orange Tip, Holly Blue, Large White, Small Tortoiseshell and Peacock butterflies. (Paul Sutton).
A Common Sandpiper, a Whitethroat and a Great Crested Grebe pair with two small young. (Eric Harris).
A Hobby flew E at 8:20am. At Cranhill Barn 8+ Skylarks, 30 Linnets, a Whitethroat, two Corn Buntings, six Swallows and two House Martins. (MK).
This morning three Whitethroats, two Linnets, four Corn Buntings, three Yellowhammers and 10+ Skylarks. (MK).
A QUAIL calling at 1:55pm at ST 84941 95358. (Paul Rich).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF still in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing  and showing, often high in the Beech canopy until 9:30am at least. (Sam Walker). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120
A drake GARGANEY on the Rushy this morning. (Tim Jukes/Dot Jones). Three Mediterranean Gulls on South Lake this afternoon. (Jonathan Bull).

Early morning at Court Lake four Shelducks, the Ross’s Goose, two Common Terns, an Oystercatcher and a Nuthatch. (MK). At 2pm four Hobbies and a Great Crested Grebe swallowing a Perch. (Richard Cawsey). Later birds included 14+Hobbies, a Red Kite, a Sparrowhawk, four Buzzards and two Oystercatchers. On the Sailing Lake an adult Yellow-legged Gull, four Herring Gulls, two Lesser Black-backed Gulls, six Common Terns, a Sedge Warbler and two Swifts. (Nick Goatman).

At The Wharf two Coots and two young, a Song Thrush, a Lesser Whitethroat, a Swallow and a Grey Heron. Along the canal a Sparrowhawk, a Chaffinch, a Garden Warbler, a Chiffchaff and a Lesser Whitethroat. From the new hide this evening 15 Mute Swans, eight Lapwings, three Shovelers, three Curlews, three Grey Herons, two Canada Geese, two Little Egrets and a Common Crane. Between the new hide and the canal six Yellow Wagtails. (Howard Taylor). From Grundon hide three Curlews, three Ringed Plovers, two Redshanks, two Greenshanks, two Avocets, two Oystercatchers, four Shelducks, four Shovelers, 31 Mallards and ten ducklings, 24 Canada Geese, five Little Egrets, four Grey Herons and seven Sand Martins. (John Fletcher).
A Chiffchaff, a Jay, a Dipper, a female Blackcap and two Buzzards today. (Paul Sutton).
A pair of Collared Doves nesting under the arches in Winchcombe Street. (Howard Taylor).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF again in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing throughout the day and showing well occasionally, often high in the Beech canopy. (Jeremy Holland et al). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120
A drake GARGANEY on the Rushy this morning. A Cuckoo at the canoe safari. (Slimbridge Sightings).

location: Sharpness Docks to Purton Timber ponds
Text: Three Lesser Whitethroats, a Cuckoo calling and a Kingfisher. (Paul Rich).
Two Common Terns at Halfpenny Bridge and four Swifts screaming around the marketplace. (Ian Sherriffs).
A Common Tern amongst the loafing and feeding gulls today. (Les Ditchburn).

No sign of the Ibis this afternoon in fields S of the Sailing Lake a Cuckoo, two Buzzards, a Shelduck and five Swallows. 6+ Common Terns on the Sailing Lake, 2+ Hobbies distant over Court Lake, 100’s of Common Blue Damselflies hatching. (MK).
At Horsbere Brook F.S.A. a Yellow Wagtail this evening. (Terry Stevenson).

A Cuckoo heard calling for an hour, sounded like it was coming from the trees between Timbercombe Wood and California Farm, S of Cheltenham. A Whitethroat at SO978184 S of California Farm. (Rose Lennard). The Mute Swan pair in Pittville park have seven cygnets, three days old. (Alan McIlquham).

At the lake and in the surrounding woodland this afternoon birds included two Little Grebes, four Canada Geese with two goslings, two Mute Swans, three Mallards, three Moorhens, a Grey Heron, three Buzzards, three Song Thrushes, two Blackcaps, two Chiffchaffs, four Grey Wagtails and a Greenfinch. (John Fletcher).

From the railway halt at Gotherington a Cuckoo and a Song Thrush heard from Ganna Lane and a Buzzard over. (Howard Taylor). A Chiffchaff calling in Bishops Cleeve. (Alan McIlquham). Three Swifts over the Kings Head Inn in Bishops Cleeve. (Howard Taylor).

Butterflies at the Bill Smyllie reserve included numerous Duke of Burgundy’s including a mating pair, Small Blues, Green Hairstreaks, Small Heath, Red Admiral, Brimstone, Orange Tip, Dingy Skippers and a Burnet Companion moth. (Chris & Phil Andrews).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF again in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing throughout the day and showing well occasionally, often high in the Beech canopy. (Peter Chappell et al). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120

The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT was reported by a visitor on one of the stick perches at Middle Point at 1:45pm. Generally it is very elusive and requires time and patience. From Kingfisher hide a male Yellow Wagtail on territory in the Four Score field, two Cuckoos, Kingfishers feeding young in the nest and a pair of Common Cranes with two chicks on the Bottom New Piece. (Slimbridge Sightings).

A  HONEY BUZZARD N over at 1:48pm watched for c5 mins soaring and gaining height. Last seen striking NNW towards the estuary N of Tites Point. Also ten Red Kites (2,2,6), a Spotted Flycatcher, a Grasshopper Warbler and a Yellow Wagtail. (Francis Steuck).
Belated news from yesterday the GLOSSY IBIS flew over the Sailing Lake at 9:45am. (Richard Cawsey).

a Little Egret,      An unringed adult Common Crane on the northern meadows. Also a Garden Warbler along the tow path. (Ian Hull). Other birds today included three Coots and four young, two Moorhens with two young, ten Mute Swans, three Canada Geese, four Grey Herons, c20 Black-headed Gulls, ten Lapwings, a Curlew, three Chiffchaffs, three Lesser Whitethroats, a Reed Warbler, a Chaffinch and a Skylark. (Howard Taylor).
A Peregrine on the Abbey today. (Alan McIlquham).
At Horsbere Brook F.S.A. a Reed Warbler, seven Linnets, four Skylarks, a Sparrowhawk and three Yellow Wagtails. (Alan Hooper).

At midday a circling Raven drifted over Benhall heading S. (David Norman). At Park Campus Lake a drake Mandarin, a Jay, a Raven, two Stock Doves, a Swift, a Nuthatch and a Grey Wagtail and seven Greylag goslings. (Steve Brown).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF again in Old Staple-edge Wood around SO 64929 10114 singing throughout the day and showing well occasionally, often high in the Beech canopy. (Paul Masters et al). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120
The GLOSSY IBIS feeding in a puddle in the Severn Ground (next field NE from Goose House) at 11:15am, but not generally viewable. (Dot Jones). A SPOONBILL on the Top New Piece today. (Martin McGill).

19 Hobbies over Court Lake this afternoon. (Nick Goatman/Roy Shilham). This evening no sign of the Glossy Ibis between Saul Warth and the 100-Acre. A Great White Egret over, three Common Cranes S, a Sparrowhawk with prey (probably a Swallow), a Kingfisher, 10+ Swifts, two Lesser Whitethroats and two Cetti’s Warblers. (MK).
This afternoon two drake Mandarins on the grass by Park Campus Lake. (David Norman).

The IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF in Old Staple-edge Wood remaining faithful to a 50 yard stretch at the edge of the wood above a wire fence at SO 64929 10114 singing throughout the day until 8pm at least and showing well occasionally, often high in the Beech canopy. (Dan Watson et al). Parking suggestions here, there are no real close access points, at least a 20 minute walk. https://twitter.com/danwatsonbirder/status/1658007284306309120

The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT heard calling several times from 1:10 to 1:15 and heard singing at 1:40pm and possibly a very brief flight view. Also on South Lake a 3CY Mediterranean Gull, a drake Pochard , a pair of of Gadwalls, an Oystercatcher and  a few Avocets with chicks, the Common Crane pair with a chick. A Cetti’s Warbler heard near Peng and another by the Duck Decoy. (Stephen Curtis & Carol Rushton). Later two Mediterranean Gull on South Lake and 46 Black-tailed Godwits, a pair of Common Cranes with a chick from Van de Bovenkamp hide and a pair of Little Ringed Plovers on the Rushy. (MK).
At Pits 41/57 a Cuckoo heard, ten Hobbies and an OSPREY over. (David Creber).

On Court lake 17 Hobbies, 20+ Swifts, a Cuckoo and the Ross’s Goose. On the Sailing Lake seven Common Terns, a Yellow Wagtail and an Oystercatcher. (Nick Goatman/John Fletcher/Allan Jeffcutt/Paul Sutton).
A Cuckoo seen and heard around the Timber Ponds. Also a pair of Mute Swans with nine cygnets, a pair of Bullfinches, many Swallows and Chiffchaffs. (Mike Davis).

An IBERIAN CHIFFCHAFF in Staple Edge wood on the small clear-fell East and downhill of the Lodge at SO649100. If accepted this is a 1st for Glos. (Greg Conway per Rob Husbands). At Crabtree Hill two Tree Pipits, two Wood Warblers, two Willow Warblers, three Blackcaps, a Whitethroat and two Wild Boar sows. At Nagshead a female Redstart, a Garden Warbler and a Roe Deer. (David Lawrence). Also a female Pied Flycatcher and a Tawny Owlet. (Andy Chapman).

The male WHITE-SPOTTED BLUETHROAT has returned to Middle Point for its 3rd year. Viewing details here https://www.wwt.org.uk/wetland-centres/slimbridge/wildlife/latest-sightings/white-spotted-bluethroat-back-on-territory. The female Red Crested Pochard in the Decoy still. (Slimbridge Sightings).
Early morning five Avocets, five Curlews N, four Oystercatchers, 18 Shelducks, two Barnacle Geese N and a Cetti’s Warbler. (MK).
A GLOSSY IBIS flew over Court Lake at 7pm last night (13th). (Aled Phillips).
A Spotted Flycatcher and two Marsh Tits near the fishing ponds. (Jamie Brown).
A singing Lesser Whitethroat in the roadside hedgerow. (Steve Kear).
Along a lane a pair of Yellow Wagtails and two singing Corn Buntings and at least one female. (Steve Kear).
This morning a Cetti’s Warbler, a Sedge Warbler, a Whitethroat, a Lesser Whitethroat, a Greenfinch, a Great Spotted Woodpecker and a Redstart. (Sarah Townsend).
A Common Sandpiper, a Whitethroat, a Blackcap, a Greenfinch, a Long-tailed Tit, a Great Crested Grebe and a Little Grebe. (Eric Harris).
A Swift over Albion Street today. (Howard Taylor).
At New Bridge three Cetti’s Warblers, also Willow, Reed, Garden and Sedge Warblers, three pairs of Shovelers, an Oystercatcher, a Redstart, a Cuckoo and a Hobby. (Keith Jennings).
Three Red Kites with 20-30 gulls and two Buzzards over a field of recently cut grass behind Carol’s Kennels this afternoon. (Ian Gorton).
This morning a Redstart singing in Oxleaze Wood near Roel Gate. Also two Red Kites over near Wardens Wood. (John Casswell).
A Raven visiting tall cedar trees and a Green Woodpecker visiting the garden pond after feeding on ants. (Roger & Sheila Wasley).
A WHITE STORK flew over the garden this evening heading towards Selsley Common. (Martin & Michelle Greenish).
Six EIDERS (3 males) off of Sharpness at 7:30am, 1 minute later they flew downriver towards Oldbury Power Station. Not seen again on the afternoon tide. (Andy Jordan).
A adult male BLACK REDSTART singing at the bottom of Southgate St/Commercial Rd 7:30 to 8:30am. At 7:40am it was on Blackfriars Priory. (Andrew Bluett).

A Spotted Flycatcher along the path to Kingfisher hide at 12:10pm. (Greg Mabbett). From Middle Point 242 Dunlins, 224 Ringed Plovers, two Sanderling, six Curlews and two Oystercatchers and a Cuckoo heard. (Helen Bojaniwska). The female Red Crested Pochard in the Decoy still. (Dot Jones).
Early morning seven Avocets, three Curlews, two Oystercatchers and 15 Shelducks. (MK).

Between Fretherne and Splatt Bridges five Lesser Whitethroats, six Sand Martins and nine Swallows flew N, two Cetti’s Warblers and another in the 100-Acre. A Great White Egret and four Swifts over the 100-Acre. (MK).

From Kingfisher hide a Cuckoo, a Sedge Warbler, male and female Kingfisher, four Common Cranes and a Reed Bunting. From Zeiss hide two Common Cranes and two chicks, 15 Avocets, 20+ Swifts, two Lapwings and an Oystercatcher. On the bird feeders a Great Spotted Woodpecker. (Jake Jenkins).
A Kingfisher near the Everhot factory at Coaley Mill at 11am. (Shane Long).
This afternoon at Severn House farm two Oystercatchers, two Little Egrets, 17 Shelducks and 56 Swallows flew N. (MK).
A Raven calling from a Scots Pine above the Race Course Station. (Howard Taylor).
16 GLOSSY IBISES flew NW over Pit 74 (Wilts) at 4.45pm heading for Gloucestershire. (John Grearson).
20 Hobbies over Court Lake today, also 50+ Swifts, five Swallows, six House Martins and six Common Terns. (Nick Goatman).
A Cuckoo calling near the Brassey GWT reserve at lunch-time. (Andy Lewis).

Early morning two Grey Plovers, three Avocets, two Oystercatchers, a Curlew, 200+ Dunlins, two Sanderlings, 50+ Ringed Plovers, a drake Gadwall, a drake Tufted Duck, the first Warth Hobby zipped through, a Kestrel, 20+ Swallows and two House Martins newly arrived, four Skylarks, four Lesser Whitethroats and a Cetti’s Warbler. (MK).
At Wardens’ Wood this morning a Cuckoo, two Chiffchaffs, a Blackcap, two Willow Warblers, a Garden Warbler, a Yellowhammer and a Long-tailed Tit. (Cottia Howard).
This morning a late female Wheatear on the Common. (Rich Hearn).
Four Common Cranes flew S at considerable height circled and apparently landed in fields in the Boxbush/Westbury-on-Severn area. (Terry Grant).

At least three Hobbies over Court Lake this morning and at Splatt Bridge, a Cuckoo calling and three Whimbrels feeding in the marshy grassland next to the N reedbed in the afternoon. (Terry Grant). Later around the pools nine Hobbies, ten Common Terns, a Cuckoo, a Common Sandpiper, a Marsh Harrier, a Lesser Whitethroat, the Ross’s Goose and two Swifts. (Nick Goatman).
A male Peregrine circling the town at 12:45pm. (Jake King).
The first three Swifts today, the same arrival date for 3rd successive year. (Harvey Sherwood).
A Grey Wagtail on top of the shop this morning and again at lunchtime at Boots Corner. (Howard Taylor).

This morning 5:15-8:10am birds included 18 Mute Swans, 17 Gadwalls, three male Shovelers, a pair of Tufted Ducks, a pair of Wigeon, five Shelducks, a Little Grebe, five Avocets, 32 Black-tailed Godwits, two Redshanks, four Lapwings, two Oystercatchers, three Little Egrets, three Grey Herons, a Peregrine, a Sparrowhawk, a Cuckoo, a Lesser Whitethroat, four Whitethroats, 6+ Reed Warblers, 6+ Sedge Warblers, a Cetti’s Warbler, two Chiffchaffs, a Swallow, a male Bullfinch and two male Reed Buntings. (MK).
A Barn Owl flew over the road at Orchard Park at 5:05am. (MK).
A drake GARGANEY on the Rushy this morning. The female Red Crested Pochard in the Decoy again. Two Mediterranean Gulls on South Lake. (Slimbridge Sightings/Roger & Sheila Wasley).
In the City an Oystercatcher again feeding on the grass verge at SO8349918690 on the left just after the station by the new construction site on Bruton Way at 8:45am. (MK).
Before noon, a female Peregrine on a Christ Church spire was joined by a male on an opposite spire. A Grey Heron in the trees on the island on the Park Campus lake. (David Norman).
At Rudge Hill this morning a Garden Warbler singing, several Willow Warblers, and a few Whitethroats. (Ian Elphick).

This afternoon birds included a Curlew, five Grey Herons, two Little Egrets, seven Greylags and six small goslings, six Mallards and three ducklings, two Shelducks, two Shovelers, a Gadwall, a Coot, two Chaffinches, a Whitethroat, two Swallows and eight Sand Martins. (John Fletcher).
A Cuckoo at Splatt Bridge today. (Nigel Young).

The female Red Crested Pochard in the Decoy again, three Mediterranean Gulls on South Lake, a Cuckoo flew past the Hogarth hide and a Garden Warbler singing along track. 2+ Sanderlings and three Bar-tailed Godwits at high tide. (Magnus Carter/Paul Masters/Paul Rich/MK).

Near to the masts four Ravens, a Red Kite, a Kestrel, four Stonechats (2m, 2f), two Linnets, a Cuckoo, many Skylarks singing, two Willow Warblers and male and female Yellowhammer. Also 1000’s of St Mark’s Flies. (Alan Hooper).

Two Tree Pipits, a male Redstart, a Wood Warbler and a Blackcap in the Crabtree Hill area. (Geoff Fawcett). A Common Crane briefly at 4pm in Littledean in the field to the side of Littledean Jail. (Beverly Stacey).
A Red Kite, a Goshawk, two Ravens, a Marsh Tit, four Treecreepers, a Spotted Flycatcher, four Mistle Thrushes and two Nightingales. Also four Yellow Wagtails in fields on the E side. (Andy Jayne).
A Cuckoo calling tonight from Lip Lane at 8:30 pm and 9pm. Also a Cuckoo calling at Breadstone at 9am. (Chris Newton).
A Peregrine panicking the Feral Pigeons over Albion Street this morning. (Howard Taylor).
A  Swift with House Martins over the town today. (Harvey Sherwood).

150+ Swifts, a Crossbill over, eight Hobbies, three Mediterranean Gulls, a Marsh Harrier, eight Common Terns, a Common Sandpiper, a male Goldeneye, four Yellow Wagtails, 100+ House Martins, 80+ Swallows, 150+ Sand Martins, four Shelducks and two Oystercatchers today. (Nick Goatman).

20 Mute Swans, three Little Egrets, an Oystercatcher, two Redshanks, a Cuckoo, Lesser Whitethroat, Whitethroat, Sedge Warbler, Chiffchaff and Blackcap today. (Eric Harris). Also today a Curlew, Little Egret, Ringed Plover and Little Ringed Plover and many Skylarks. (Sarah Townsend).

At high tide from birds included two Grey Plovers, two Turnstones, four Bar-tailed Godwits, five Sanderlings, 260 Dunlins and 97 Ringed Plovers. On South Lake five second calendar year Mediterranean Gulls and the female Red-crested Pochard in the Duck Decoy. On the Rushy a Little Ringed Plover and a drake Pochard early morning. (Martin McGill). From Knott hide, a Little Grebe with two chicks, Reed Warblers, Sedge Warblers, two Reed Buntings, Willow Warbler and Blackcap. Two singing Cetti’s Warblers along the South Finger. From Kingfisher hide, two Kingfishers. (Chris Newton).
Along the canal this morning 5+ Gadwalls, two pairs of Tufted Ducks, Sedge Warblers, a Common Crane, a pair of Oystercatchers, Blackcaps and a Cuckoo calling. (Mike Davis).
Early morning two Bar-tailed Godwits, two Grey Plovers, 200+ each of Dunlins and Ringed Plovers, an Oystercatcher and a Curlew. Two Lesser Whitethroats along the canal. (MK).
A Cuckoo today. (Mark Dowie).

A Woodcock over the garden in Cinderford at 8:55pm. (Owen Follis). Two pairs of Pied Flycatchers and a pair of Redstarts today. (Geoff Fawcett). At Clearwell/Newland on farmland in the Rookery Lane area 12 Swallows, a Swift, a Whitethroat, a pair of Yellowhammers, five Skylarks, a pair of Linnets, a Red Kite and three Fallow Deer. (Alan Waterman).

The WHITE STORK flew low S over the garden in the village at 2:45pm. It continued S and was last seen over Falfield. (Gordon Hodgson). At least five Hobbies at Court Lake this morning. (Paul Rich). A Sedge Warbler singing in scrub at Church End this evening. (per Sue Spurr).

A WHITE STORK circled over the Rushy at 2:10pm and headed NE towards Frampton. (Slimbridge Sightings). A GARGANEY from the Estuary Tower on the Tack Piece. (Esther Rumsey). From Middle Point this morning two Sanderlings with a large Ringed Plover and Dunlin flock on the Dumbles. Three Grey Plovers, 12 Bar-tailed Godwits and four Great Crested Grebes on the river. (Jeremy Holland). The female Red Crested Pochard still on South Lake. (Alan McIlquham).

Today a WOOD SANDPIPER still from Grundon hide. Also today birds included a White-fronted Goose, two Redshanks, a Curlew, two Lapwings, three Oystercatchers, 20 Gadwalls, ten Shelducks, two Shovelers, four Wigeon, a Teal, 12 Mallards, seven Mute Swans, 14 Canada Geese, four Little Egrets, four Grey Heron, 17 Coots, two Swallows, two Swifts, two Cuckoos heard, two Lesser Whitethroats, six Sedge Warblers, three Cetti’s Warblers, three Blackcaps, three Chiffchaffs, three Whitethroats, a Willow Warbler, a Reed Warbler, four Linnets and two Reed Buntings. (David Lawrence/Mark Hobson/Simon Bradfield).

At the Elmore Court Rewilding Project from the public footpath along Broadmeadow Bank Ditch birds today included an Oystercatcher, five Canada Geese, a Wheatear, probably Greenland, two Sedge Warblers, a Lesser Whitethroat and a pair of Ravens. (MK).
This morning three Nightingales singing. (Simon Bradfield).

At Nagshead a pair of Pied Flycatchers and Mandarin today. A Redstart and many Tree Pipits at Crabtree Hill. (Simon Bradfield). Also at Nagshead a roosting Tawny Owl and a Redstart. At Cannop Ponds a pair of Grey Wagtails at the sluice gates. (Roger & Sheila Wasley). At Woorgreens a Cuckoo, several Garden Warblers, 6+ Wood Warblers in surrounding woods and seven male Tree Pipits. (Rob Husbands).
60+ Swifts milling over the valley this evening, most then slowly moving N. Also a Red Kite and a pair of Kestrels, the male displaying. (Terry Grant).

At Rudge Hill NNR late afternoon male and female Bullfinch, two Great Spotted Woodpeckers, a Willow Warbler, a few of each Chiffchaffs and Blackcaps heard, three Song Thrushes, a Kestrel and two Buzzards. (John Fletcher).
A male Redstart heard this morning. (Colin Greenfield).
A pair of Bullfinches in the garden feeding on Goat Willow this afternoon. (Martin Vaisey).

Early this morning a reeling Grasshopper Warbler by the car park. (John Casswell). Other birds today included two WOOD SANDPIPERS still, a Little Ringed Plover, a Ruff, 4+ Redshanks, an Oystercatcher, two Curlews, a pair of Little Grebes, three Little Egrets, eight Grey Herons, a Common Tern, a Sedge Warbler, three Reed Warblers, 2+ Whitethroats, 1+Cetti’s Warbler, a Swift, a Cuckoo, a male Bullfinch and two Reed Buntings. (Paul Masters/Ian Ralphs/John Casswell/Christopher Widdowson/Sam Walker).

From the Estuary Tower this morning eight Grey Plovers, three Sanderlings, two Turnstones and a brief, distant WOOD SANDPIPER. (Andy Jayne/Paul Rich). A WOOD SANDPIPER, presumably the same bird, from Zeiss hide at 4:30pm. (Slimbridge Sightings). The female Red Crested Pochard still on South Lake today. (Jeanne Vitkovskis). Also a drake Mandarin on South Lake and the Common Crane pair at Zeiss hide have hatched a chick. (Molly Gould). A Mediterranean Gull on the wader scrape from Hogarth hide. (Julian Gould).

This afternoon along the Monarch’s Way to Kingston’s barn, a Yellow Wagtail, a female Wheatear and a singing Corn Bunting. (Vic Polley). This evening three Yellow Wagtails, three Wheatears and two Corn Buntings. (Paul Rich).
Two Wheatears on the golf course and a Cuckoo calling this morning. (Duncan Dine).
Five Common Terns, an Oystercatcher and three Swifts early morning. (MK/Molly Gould). A Hobby over Court Lake this morning. (Jake King).

This afternoon two WOOD SANDPIPERS, a Ruff, two Black-tailed Godwits, three Little Egrets and the White-fronted Goose and two pairs of Wigeon still. Also a Cuckoo calling and a Lesser Whitethroat singing near the Wharf until 4pm at least. (Jeremy Holland/Richard Price/David Creber/Chris Moore/Alan McIlquham). A male Redstart at 1:30pm. (Nigel Young).

On the Sailing Lake an adult LITTLE GULL until late afternoon at least, seven Common Terns, two Oystercatchers, 40+ Swifts, 20+ Swallows, 100+ Sand Martins and five House Martins. (Nick Goatman). Six Hobbies hawking low over Court Lake at 2pm. (Colin Greenfield).

On South Lake a Little Ringed Plover at 2:30pm, a Common Sandpiper, a female Red Crested Pochard, 58 Black-tailed Godwit,19 Ruff, a pair of Great Crested Grebes and two Mediterranean Gulls. (Ian Hull). At Middle Point (Summer Walkway now open) two Whimbrels, a Wheatear and two Whinchats. (Amy Harley/Martin Price/Steve Pullen). From Knott hide a pair of Little Grebes with three chicks. (Dot Jones). At high tide 145+ Dunlins, 25+ Ringed Plovers, two Sanderlings, a Whimbrel, a Curlew, two Oystercatchers and four Redshanks. (Neil Smart). A Cuckoo today from the Van de Bovenkamp hide. (John Elley).

A Whitethroat, Tree Pipits and a male Redstart on Crabtree Hill this morning. (Geoff Fawcett). At least three and possibly four Woodcocks, including a bird on the ground this evening at Crabtree Hill, but no Nightjar yet. (Frank Williams).
An Oystercatcher again on a grass island feeding well along Bruton Way by the construction site at 10:25am (6th reported sighting). (Andrew Bluett).
This evening two Lesser Whitethroats singing in a thick hedge by the railway line at the foot of Churchdown Hill S of John Daniels Way. (Rob Crofton).
A WOOD SANDPIPER, two Curlews, two Oystercatchers, five Redshanks, a Whimbrel, a Greenshank, a Ringed Plover, a Little Ringed Plover, a Reed Warbler and a Little Owl. (Ian Hull).

On South Lake a female Red Crested Pochard, a drake Goldeneye, four Mediterranean Gulls, 95 Black-tailed Godwits, 20+ Ruff, three Common Sandpipers and 62 Avocets and a Greenshank from Hogarth hide. (Slimbridge Sightings/Mike Davis).
Two Marsh Tits and a Raven and seven Buzzards together on the ground. (Dan Fletcher).
A Red Kite flew over very low at 1:20pm heading E towards Cheltenham. (Dave Stone).
A Cuckoo calling for c20 minutes intermittently between Saul Junction and Whitminster Church from 3pm. (Tanya Allen).
Around the orchards this morning two Lesser Whitethroats, five Whitethroats, five Reed Warblers and two Sedge Warblers by the river, four Buzzards, four Stock Doves and two Skylarks. (Steve Pullen).

Around the meadow bordered by Kidnappers Lane, a Lesser Whitethroat, several singing Blackcaps and two females seen, two Chiffchaffs, 4+ singing Greenfinches, two Ravens and a Green Woodpecker calling in the smallholdings. Also two Holly Blues, three Speckled Woods and several Orange Tip butterflies. (Steve Brown).

At Nagshead four Pied Flycatchers, four Siskins, two Garden Warblers, four Mandarins and a Sparrowhawk. At New Fancy View seven Crossbills, a Cuckoo, three Siskins, a Garden Warbler, a Swift, two Swallows, two Sand Martins and a Lesser Whitethroat. At Woorgreens 2 possibly 3 Wood Warblers. (Nigel Sluman). A SPOTTED FLYCATCHER at Nagshead this afternoon. (Terry Stevenson).
At lunchtime a Nightingale, a Garden Warbler and a pair of Bullfinches. (Nigel Sluman).
At the Sailing Lake early morning an Arctic Tern, seven Common Tern, a female Marsh Harrier, two Oystercatchers and four Shelducks. (Nick Goatman).

A Tree Pipit, two Yellowhammers, three Willow Warblers,
a Chiffchaff, a small party of Linnets and two Swallows through. (Steve Brown).

In the woods today, a male Bullfinch, a Nuthatch, two Treecreepers, two Great Spotted Woodpeckers, a singing Mistle Thrush and many Chiffchaffs, also two Brimstones, two Speckled Woods, an Orange Tip and a male Holly Blue. (Chris Newton).

Late morning two Shelducks, a Great White Egret, seven Little Egrets and 13 Grey Herons. Also 9+ Mute Swans in a field beyond the willows and 1+ Curlew heard. (Andy & Sue Gibbons). Also today three Shovelers, three Gadwalls, an Oystercatcher, five Greylags, six Canada Geese, 17 Coots, 21 Mallards, a Shelduck, a drake Teal, two Chiffchaffs and two Swallows. (John Fletcher).
A Red Kite circling over the village at 5:45pm. (John Fletcher).
Two Curlews on the Great Meadow, viewed from Dock Lane picnic site at Bredon, Worcs. (Andy & Sue Gibbons).

In Warden’s Wood this morning five Willow Warblers, five Blackcaps, three Chiffchaffs, a Buzzard and a pair of Bullfinches. Also a Peacock, a Comma and a Holly Blue butterfly. On the Common near the pylons two Wheatears, two Whitethroats and a Red Kite. A small amount of Swallow passage N.
A pair of Great Crested Grebes today. (Howard Taylor). At Arle Grove near Dowdeswell Wood a pair of Ravens and an Orange Tip butterfly. (Keith White).
Four Hobbies over Court Lake today. (Paul Dunham). Later five Hobbies, two adult Mediterranean Gulls, nine Common Terns, an ARCTIC TERN and three Oystercatchers. (Nick Goatman).
Two Nightingales today. (Paul Dunham/Terry Stevenson/Tom Berry).
An adult and a 2nd summer Mediterranean Gull and a drake Goldeneye on South Lake. (Magnus Carter). A Goshawk circling high over the Rushy being mobbed by Black-headed Gulls. (James Robinson).

A breeding-plumage Golden Plover near the heather enclosure this morning. (Andy Lewis). This afternoon at least four Red Kites, two Buzzards, a Kestrel, Ravens, Skylarks, Meadow Pipits, a Marsh Tit, a Great Spotted Woodpecker, a Linnet flock, a Chiffchaff, a Willow Warbler and a Cuckoo. (Chris Moore).
This afternoon a Corn Bunting, four Yellowhammers, a Yellow Wagtail, a Willow Warbler singing, eight Linnets, four Whitethroats and four Red Kites. (Steve Pullen).

On the footpath from Shurdington four Linnets, five Chiffchaffs, three Great Spotted Woodpeckers, two Goldcrests, two Swallows, a Song Thrush, a Whitethroat, a Blackcap, a Buzzard, a Stock Dove, a Grey Heron, two Roe Deer and an Orange Tip. (Howard Taylor).
A Hobby at 1pm flying high N over the garden at St Lawrence Church, Barnwood. (Rob Crofton).
A Hobby over Whiteway Hill at 6:35pm. (Phil Pope).
An Oystercatcher beside Bruton Way at 10:45am today. This is the 4th sighting in the City. (Chris Sandys).
From the hide a Great White Egret, six Little Egrets, eight Grey Herons, eight Shovelers, 12 Gadwalls, six Teal, 32 Coots, a Shelduck, a pair of Lapwings and a Curlew. (Richard Humphrey).
At midday today, 13 Buzzards circling together and a Grey Heron on a neighbouring roof in Worley being mobbed by gulls and Jackdaws. (Mike Kom).

A Grey Wagtail on the River Chelt in Arle and a pair of Blackcaps
nearby. Over the Park Campus a Peregrine, a Buzzard and six large gulls disputing airspace high up. (Steve Brown).

A drake GARGANEY on the Tack Piece and a Great White Egret from Martin Smith hide. Two 2nd calendar year Mediterranean Gulls on South Lake. From Estuary Tower two Whimbrels and a Wheatear. (Slimbridge Sightings).

The White-fronted Goose still, eight Dunlins with 18 Black-tailed Godwits, a Redshank, a Little Grebe, a Great Crested Grebe, six Little Egrets, a Great White Egret, a Cuckoo, a Lesser Whitethroat, a Sedge Warbler, six Swifts and a Yellow Wagtail. Four Ringed Plovers dropped in briefly at 11am. (Jeremy Holland/Les Ditchburn/Duncan & Becky Dine).
At first light a Nightingale and a Marsh Tit. (Owen Follis).
At Nagshead at 6:30am a Redstart, a Pied Flycatcher, a Firecrest and a Garden Warbler. (Owen Follis).

From Splatt Bridge this morning with three Common Cranes flew S, six Whimbrels, a 3rd calendar year Mediterranean Gull, three Common Terns, a Hobby and a Lesser Redpoll through. Two Reed Warblers at Saul Lodge and c30 Swifts. (Gordon Hodgson/Martin Wightman). A Cuckoo and two Great White Egrets at Splatt Bridge at 1pm. (Shane Long). Around the pools pools a Marsh Harrier, a Yellow Wagtail, a Cuckoo, 28 Swifts, three Common Terns, eight Whitethroats, two Lesser Whitethroats, 10+ Reed Warblers, three Oystercatchers, 36 Chiffchaffs, 32 Blackcaps, 12 Sand Martins, eight Swallows, a Meadow Pipit, ten Skylarks and a Raven. (Nick Goatman). Also five Hobbies hunting over Court lake this afternoon and the Ross’s Goose. On the Sailing Lake four Common Terns and two Kingfishers. (Steve Pullen).
At Castlemeads a Sedge Warbler and two Whitethroats near the car park. (Steve Pullen).
Four Sedge Warblers, three Garden Warblers, at least ten Reed Warblers and lots of Blackcaps and Chiffchaffs in the hedgerows and reeds around Pit 125 today. (Ian Davies).
A Grasshopper Warbler reeling at dusk. (Andy Jayne).
A mixed group of at least 13 Buzzards and Red Kites soaring on the up-draughts at the Washpool late morning. (Pete Rodgers).
50+ Linnets feeding on dandelion seedheads in a field E of Vineyards Farm at SO973186. (Rose Lennard).
Two Firecrests and a Cuckoo calling today in Silk Wood. (Megan Adamou).
This morning a Hobby, a Kestrel over, five Grey Herons in a clover field, two male Whitethroats and a singing Song Thrush. (Chris Newton).

Two Greenfinches, five Song Thrushes, two Long-tailed Tits, two Swallows, a Great Spotted Woodpecker, a Whitethroat, two Skylarks, a Raven, 15 Mallards including five ducklings, two Grey Herons, three Buzzards and a Peregrine. (John Fletcher).

A Woodpigeon taking nesting material to a plinth above the entrance to Regents Arcade, High Street. A Mistle Thrush on Pittville Lawn, young Blue Tits heard and a Grey Heron fishing on the Pump Rooms lake. (Howard Taylor).
